info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 10:12AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN HAMILTON AND NORTHERN CLERMONT COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 AM EDT... At 1012 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Plainville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Norwood, Blue Ash, Loveland, Montgomery, Madeira, Milford, Deer Park, Forestville, Amelia, Mariemont, Williamsburg, Terrace Park, Batavia, Salem Heights, Camp Dennison, Withamsville, Rossmoyne, Remington and Plainville. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 8 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
